title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 270-5.3 - Service of notice of application
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 270-5.3 - Service of notice of application

State Regulations

The applicant shall serve a notice of application to
apply for such grant upon the city, town or village in which the land is
situated and upon the owner of properties adjoining along the shorefront. Such
notice of application shall state the date on which the application will be
made to the Commissioner of General Services and shall contain a description of
the land underwater applied for, the use of the land underwater applied for, and directions that all objections to such application shall be filed with the

Division of Land Utilization on or before the date such application will be
made. All such notices shall be served 20 days before the date such application
will be made. Affidavits of service of such notice shall be attached to the
notice of application. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
270-5.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
